title: Redefines the term "emergency" for purposes of state procurement policy; specifies that an agency's failure to plan in advance does not constitute an emergency
summary: Redefines the term "emergency" for purposes of state procurement policy; specifies that an agency's failure to plan in advance, which results in a situation in which normal practices cannot be followed does not constitute an emergency.

       Introduced  by  M.  of A. DESTITO, GALEF, BRENNAN, MARKEY -- Multi-Spon-

       AN  ACT to amend the state finance law, in relation to the definition of
         "emergency" in the procurement process

         THE PEOPLE OF THE STATE OF NEW YORK, REPRESENTED IN SENATE AND  ASSEM-
       BLY, DO ENACT AS FOLLOWS:

    1    Section  1.  Paragraph  b of subdivision 1 of section 163 of the state
    2  finance law, as added by chapter 83 of the laws of 1995, is  amended  to
    3  read as follows:
    4    b. "Emergency" means an urgent and unexpected requirement where health
    5  and  public  safety  or the conservation of public resources is at risk,
    6  WHICH CREATES AN IMMINENT DANGER AND PRESSING  NECESSITY  FOR  IMMEDIATE
    7  ATTENTION  TO  PERMIT THE SAFE CONTINUATION OF A NECESSARY PUBLIC USE OR
    8  FUNCTION, OR TO PROTECT THE PROPERTY OF THE STATE OF NEW  YORK,  OR  THE
    9  LIFE,  SAFETY,  OR  HEALTH OF ANY PERSON. AN AGENCY'S FAILURE TO PLAN IN
   10  ADVANCE, INCLUDING A FAILED PROCUREMENT  PROCESS,  WHICH  RESULTS  IN  A
   11  SITUATION  IN WHICH NORMAL PRACTICES CANNOT BE FOLLOWED DOES NOT CONSTI-
   12  TUTE AN EMERGENCY. AN EMERGENCY MUST BE DECLARED BY THE GOVERNOR.
   13    S 2. This act shall take effect on the one hundred twentieth day after
   14  it shall have become a law; provided, however, that effective immediate-
   15  ly, the addition, amendment and/or repeal of any  rules  or  regulations
   16  necessary  for  the  implementation of this act on its effective date is
   17  authorized and directed to be made  and  completed  on  or  before  such
   18  effective  date;  and  provided  further, however, that the amendment to
   19  paragraph b of subdivision 1 of section 163 of  the  state  finance  law
   20  made  by  section  one  of  this act shall not affect the repeal of such
   21  section and shall be deemed repealed therewith.


        EXPLANATION--Matter in ITALICS (underscored) is new; matter in brackets
                             [ ] is old law to be omitted.
